Description: sale of children's sweatshirts and jackets
Info Source: http://www.cpsc.gov/en/Newsroom/News-Releases/2013/Ross-Stores-Agrees-to-39-Million-Civil-Penalty-Internal-Compliance-Improvements-for-Failure-to-Report-Drawstrings-in-Childrens-Upper-Outerwear-/

Description: Ross Stores Inc. agreed to pay a civil penalty of $500,000 to resolve CPSC staff allegations that it knowingly failed to report to CPSC immediately, as required by federal law, that children's hooded sweatshirts it sold had drawstrings at the neck.
Info Source: https://www.cpsc.gov/Newsroom/News-Releases/2009/Ross-Stores-Agrees-To-Pay-500000-Civil-Penalty-For-Failing-To-Report-Drawstrings-In-Childrens-Outerwear

Description: The Justice Department reached an agreement with Ross Stores Inc. resolving allegations that the company had engaged in a pattern or practice of discrimination based on citizenship status while verifying employment eligibility at its store in San Ysidro, Calif.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/justice-department-settles-document-abuse-claim-against-ross-stores-inc

Description: A group of major retailers and a group of jewelry manufacturers joined a settlement involving the presence of lead in costume jewelry sold to children.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-lockyer-announces-settlement-major-us-companies-reduce-lead
https://ww2.arb.ca.gov/ross-stores-inc-settlement-2016

Description: Ross Stores paid a total of $2,550,000 in civil penalties, $340,000 for Supplemental Environmental Projects, and $445,000 in costs, to 38 District Attorneys and two City Attorneys in settling claims that it unlawfully disposed of hazardous waste in municipal landfills not authorized to accept it.
Info Source: https://www.alcoda.org/newsroom/2020/dec/ross_to_pay_settlement_for_violations
